lines.text: London, 1943. After escaping from Germany, RAF Sergeant John Dougall is questioned about his journey by a French Intelligence officer.
Someone followed me out. I thought is was a Resistance contact, but soon realized...
Why that crazy business in the cafe?
Smoking an English cigarette when you had Gauloises?
Montigny road, two kilometers, a bridge. Keep to the stream on the left to a big farm.
Good. In the stable you'll find two bicycles. I'll arrange that.
There'll be a small packet of food on the first bicycle.
Rolled inside the handlebar grip you'll find instructions. Got that? Off you go. Bon Voyage.

One of the regulars at that cafe was a small-time Vichy spy. Stefan lighting an English cigarette there was no accident. It was a bit like yelling "Vive de Gaulle!" at Gestapo headquarters. The idea was to attract the attention not only of the spy but of the man and woman from the Resistance whom you later saw in the wine cellar.
Au revoir, Mademoiselle. Thanks for everything. I very much hope we'll meet again.
